main event: A bright, glowing object was observed in the sky over Bedford, Ohio on October 24, 1963.
interesting points: The object was described as being larger than the sun but brighter, and it had a whitish color.
The object glided with a wobbling motion and flashed or flickered.
The object's speed was estimated to be around 2,500 mph.
The witness reported that the object appeared to just hover in the sky and was very still and silent, with no visible source of propulsion.
The witness has seen many strange things in the sky, but this was one of the brightest and most unusual sightings.
result: Probable Balloon, Possible Astronomical, Possible Balloon
sighted object: a bright, glowing object in the sky
